definition: to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

sentences.english: Clean and bright, You look happy to meet me.
sentences.chinese: 小而白，洁又亮，见到我你面露喜色。

sentences.english: They brightened up at the mention of these things.
sentences.chinese: 一提到这些事情他们就面露喜色。

sentences.english: He brightened up at the mention of tea.
sentences.chinese: 一提到茶他就面露喜色。

sentences.english: On hearing the news his face brightened up.
sentences.chinese: 听到这消息他脸上露出了喜色。

sentences.english: Her face lightened at the sight of her friend.
sentences.chinese: 一看到朋友她便面露喜色。

sentences.english: Mark and Connie both instantly beamed.
Her face was lighted by the news.
sentences.chinese: 她听到这个消息后面露喜色。

sentences.english: The bail-out gratified some Wall Street bankers.
sentences.chinese: 拯救计划让华尔街的银行家们面露喜色。

sentences.english: Her face lighted up when she heard the news.
sentences.chinese: 听到那个消息，她面露喜色。

sentences.english: Sue's face lit up when she heard the good news.
sentences.chinese: 苏听到这个好消息时面露喜色。

sentences.english: Her face cleared up as she read the letter.
sentences.chinese: 她看信的时候面露喜色。

sentences.english: Her face cleared up when she read the letter.
Such as hook up for a new residential, month, the celebration of laughter warmth in today.
sentences.chinese: 喜色迎来新人居，月如钩，福庆笑语温情在今日。

sentences.english: A wonderful joy had transfigured this old man.
sentences.chinese: 一阵眉开眼笑的喜色好象改变了老人的容貌。

sentences.english: His face lit up with pleasure when he received the letter of acceptance.
sentences.chinese: 当他收到录取通知书时脸上露出喜色。

definition: face light up with delight (idiom); to beam with joy
hidden smile/smirk/to rejoice covertly/secret satisfaction concerning one's evil plans
to have heard what was said
